name: mapreduce.task.io.sort.factor
description:
The number of streams to merge at once while sorting
  files.  This determines the number of open file handles.

name: dfs.blockreport.incremental.intervalMsec
description:
If set to a positive integer, the value in ms to wait between sending
    incremental block reports from the Datanode to the Namenode.

name: dfs.content-summary.sleep-microsec
description:
The length of time in microseconds to put the thread to sleep, between reaquiring the locks
    in content summary computation.

name: mapreduce.job.encrypted-intermediate-data-key-size-bits
description: Mapreduce encrypt data key size default is 128

name: dfs.namenode.blockreport.max.lock.hold.time
description: The BlockReportProcessingThread max write lock hold time in ms.

name: dfs.namenode.replication.max-streams
description: Hard limit for the number of replication streams other than those with highest-priority.

name: dfs.disk.balancer.block.tolerance.percent
description:
When a disk balancer copy operation is proceeding, the datanode is still
      active. So it might not be possible to move the exactly specified
      amount of data. So tolerance allows us to define a percentage which
      defines a good enough move.

name: ipc.[port_number].weighted-cost.handler
description:
The weight multiplier to apply to the time spent in the
    HANDLER phase which do not involve holding a lock.
    See org.apache.hadoop.ipc.ProcessingDetails.Timing for more details on
    this phase. This property applies to WeightedTimeCostProvider.
